New Records: Jasson Domínguez became the youngest Yankees player to homer in his first career game at just 20 years, 206 days old.
Key Match Events: Jasson Domínguez hit a two-run home run against the Houston Astros in his first major league at-bat.
Pre-Game Insights: Aaron Boone said that everyone's excited for Jasson Domínguez and Austin Wells, and looking forward to watching them go spread their wings and continue to develop and hopefully see some good things.
Post-Match Reflections: Domínguez said that he knew it was going to be a lot of different feelings finally stepping on the field, and he was happy to be right there today, and it's a special day.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Domínguez is expected to be the team's everyday center fielder after Harrison Bader was claimed off waivers by the Cincinnati Reds.
Others: The Yankees won 6-2, with Jasson Domínguez finishing 1 for 4 and Austin Wells finishing 1 for 4.
